activities.loc: Richland County Courtroom, Floor C, Courthouse

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

1:01 PM Defendant John P. Keegan appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Jennifer M. Harper in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Stroud appears in person. Attorney Stroud has received the complaint and hasn't spoken with his client but is prepared to waive the formal reading today. Attorney Stroud waives the time limits to the preliminary hearing. JK is currently on a supervision hold.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for November 9, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Preliminary hearing on November 9, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

1:09 PM Defendant John Keegan appeared by video, in custody. Attorney Harper appears in person. JK doesn't have an attorney.

State heard and asks for $ 20,000 cash bond
Defendant shall not possess or consume any alcohol and shall submit to evidentiary testing of blood, breath or urine, on demand of law enforcement, to monitor compliance. No entry into bars, taverns, or any establishment of which the primary purpose is the sale of alcohol, Phoenix Center included. 

JK isn't able to post any amount of money.

Court orders $5,000 cash
Defendant shall not possess or consume any alcohol and shall submit to evidentiary testing of blood, breath or urine, on reasonable demand of law enforcement, to monitor compliance. No entry into bars, taverns, or any establishment of which the primary purpose is the sale of alcohol, Phoenix Center included
Hearing scheduled for September 13, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
